pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:0.4: The sub-chapter on containing living beings
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:0.5: 62. The training rule on containing living beings
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:1.2: the monks from the group of six were using water that they knew contained living beings.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:1.3: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:1.4: “How can the monks from the group of six use water that they know contains living beings?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:1.5: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:1.8: “Foolish men, how can you do this?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:1.10: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:1.11.1: ‘If a monk uses water that he knows contains living beings, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:2.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:2.1.6: he knows by himself or others have told him.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:2.1.7: If he uses it, knowing that it contains living beings and knowing that they will die if the water is used, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:2.2.1: If it contains living beings, and he perceives it as such, and he uses it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:2.2.2: If it contains living beings, but he is unsure of it, and he uses it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:2.2.3: If it contains living beings, but he does not perceive it as such, and he uses it, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:2.2.4: If it does not contain living beings, but he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:2.2.5: If it does not contain living beings, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:2.2.6: If it does not contain living beings, and he does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:2.3.2: if he does not know that it contains living beings;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:2.3.3: if he knows that it does not contain living beings;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:2.3.4: if he uses it knowing that they will not die;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:2.3.6: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:2.3.7: The training rule on containing living beings, the second, is finished.
